sen.j: 狭義には音羽山清水寺の参道である清水坂から北へ石段で降りる坂道をいうが、公式には北に二年坂までの緩い起伏の石畳の道も含む。
sen.e: Narrowly, it means the descending road in the north of Kiyomizu-zaka Slope, an approach to Otowasan Kyomizu-dera Temple, but officially, it also includes the slightly undulating stone-paved road up to Ninen-zaka Slope (a two-year slope literally).

sen.j: 二年坂を介して北にある八坂神社、円山公園 (京都府)、高台寺、法観寺（八坂の塔）と南にある清水寺を結んでいるため、観光客が絶えない。
sen.e: Connecting Yasaka-jinja Shrine, Maruyama-koen Park (located in Kyoto Prefecture), Kodai-ji Temple and Hokan-ji Temple (Yasaka-no-to Pagoda) in the north (via Ninenn-zaka Slope) and Kyomizu-dera Temple in the south, it is always visited by sightseers.

sen.j: 重要伝統的建造物群保存地区としての産寧坂は通りの範囲より広く、東山区祇園町南側、清水二丁目、清水三丁目、下河原町、南町、鷲尾町、金園町、八坂上町および枡屋町の各一部、約5.3haになる。
sen.e: The Sannei-zaka Slope designated as an area where important traditional buildings must be protected is larger than the area specified by the street and covers approx. 5.3 ha, which comprises the south side of Gion Cho, Higashiyama Ward, Kiyomizu Ni Chome, Kiyomizu San Chome, Shimokawara Cho, Minami Machi, Minami Machi, Kinen Cho, and part of Yasaka Kami Machi and of Masuya Cho.
